w:r.w:t: Purposes of this Recommendation are to describe for Centrifugal compressors and Steam Turbines:
The methodology for defining whether a major or a minor overhaul shall be done.
The different steps during overhauls on centrifugal compressor trains and steam turbines.
This document applies to industrial sites of
Methodology for defining scope of work
Minor vs Major Compressor overhaul chart
Minor vs Major Steam Turbines overhaul chart
Minor vs Major Gears overhaul chart
This Recommendation covers the Major Trains Overhaul scope of work
al Purpose Gears and lube oil system
. It does not concern variable speed motors that should be covered by a separate document or future updating of the present document.
all turnaround to define the scope of work on major trains.
Methodology for defining scope of work
rotating machines scope of work shall be identified
, and not more than 24 months before the Turnaround.
The scope of work shall be updated if additional information lead to a different type of overhaul.
shall be based on vibrations trends, events on the last period, process recommendation (e.g efficiency or fouling evidence), know
long term issues (e.g repetitive cracks on impellers)
attached in appendix shall be used to help on defining the scope
Appendix 1 – Minor vs Major Compressor overhaul chart
n opportunity to upgrade machinery monitoring
The chapters below are listing the different
tasks to be covered in the overhaul scope, addressing
be in charge of each task.
All the tasks described in the tables
Before Shutdown record all readings on the machine (vibrations, temperatures,
displacement…) and the support systems (position of hangers, status of slidin
/fixed piping support) for the possibility to compare before / after T&I.
Evaluate with Instrumentation people, before T&I whether or not vibration, speed, axial or temperature measurements shall be
Ensure that suction strainers have been checked
Ensure that discharge check valves have been checked
Check and replace hangers for inlet and outlet lines
Check control valves in oil system
Remove coupling guards and coupling spacers
Look for/check if any soft foot
Record coupling hub position vs shaft (especially when shrink fit)
All open oil lines must be sealed with plastic bags and taped
Record Seal position vs shaft and /or seal compression
Record rotor end float (position front rear / casing)
Check overhead tank system (including non retu
n valve, level switch, start-up sequence
Check level transmitter in seal oil systems with overhead tank
Check control valve(s) for buffer gas
Check nitrogen pressure controller for N2-purge between bearing and seal
Check reference gas line in seal oil systems with overhead tank
Replace damaged parts/parts out of tolerance
Reinstall thrust bearing and check rotor position
Confirm axial probes indicate same clearance as measured
Control distance between shaft ends, when rotor is on active thrust bearing, measure spacer length to define prestretch
Check alignment and record // OO and DBSE
g of rotor refer to GM RC MEC
underlined tasks to be considered as hold points.
there is an intermediate bushing between seal cartridge and compressor casing, a leak test between this intermediate bushing and the compressor casing shall be implemented. To do so
a dummy cartridge (blind) shall be fitted inside intermediate bushing and each port shall be free of leak.
This is especially recommended for Dry Gas Seal
On Dry Gas Seal cartridge ensure that all required holes are plugged before re-installation.
Ensure that suction strainers have been checked
Ensure that discharge check valves have been checked
nsure that antisurge valves have been checked
Check/replace hangers for inlet and outlet lines
Check control valves in oil system
Remove coupling guards and coupling spacers
Look for/check if any soft foot
Record coupling hub position vs shaft (especially when shrink fit)
All open oil lines must be sealed with plastic bags and tapedoff
Record Seal position vs shaft and /or seal compression
Record rotor end float (position front rear / casing)
Check level transmitter in seal oil systems with overhead tank
Check control valve(s) for buffer gas
Check nitrogen pressure controller for N2-purge between bearing and seal
Check reference gas line in seal oil systems with overhead tank
Replace damaged parts/parts out of tolerance
Install Scaffolding around the compressor split line
Lower top half casing in lay down area and turn over
Remove liquid remaining out of bottom diaphragms
Transport rotor to lay down area
Lift diaphragm out of bottom/top casing
Check compressor split line (flatness) or blue check with top cover
Transport diaphragm to lay down area
Reinstall thrust bearing and check rotor position
Check clearance and record (bearing radial and thrust)
Confirm axial probes indicate same clearance as measured
Check laby clearances bottom half and record
Check laby clearances top half using lead wire and record
Tight split lines bolt at torque
Check rotor position and axial/radial clearance
Control distance between shaft ends, when rotor is on active thrust bearing, measure spacer length
Check alignment and record // OO and DBSE
Check coupling fitting (hub position vs shaft end) and bolting before closing guards
Zeroing of rotor refer to GM RC MEC 670
tasks to be considered as hold points.

there is an intermediate bushing between seal cartridge and compressor casing, a leak test between this intermediate bushing and the compressor casing shall be implemented. To do so, a dummy cartridge (blind) shall be fitted inside intermediate bushing and each port shall be free of leak. This is especially recommended for Dry Gas Seal
Once removed from the machine, rotors shall not be stored outside without being protected from ambient moisture, to prevent form corrosion.
for heavy parts (casing half- cover, casing half-cover turnover, rotor, complete machine) shall be done according site procedure with a corresponding lifting
On Dry Gas Seal cartridge ensure that all required holes are plugged before re-installation.
Stop oil pumps when bearing T° < 60°C or machine is stop
Ensure that check valve located at extraction (or discharge) are checked by relevant discipline
All oil lines to be sealed with plastic bags and taped
Overhaul of trip valve, check and replace components (springs, bolts, bushings, valve stem)
. For bolts which temperature is higher than 300°C replace bolts after 12 years in service
Blue check of all valves/seats of control and trip valves
Check overhead tank system (including non return valve, level switch, start-up sequence
Check main condenser (including level measurement) and steam ejectors (if any)
Overhaul extraction piloted check valve (if any) for bolts chich temperature is above 300°C replace bolts after 12 years in service
Check rotor end float and axial position and record
Check radial and thrust bearing clearances and record
Confirm axial position probes indicate same clearance as measured
Remove and clean bearing housing plates
Check internal alignment rotor- bearing house and record
Check clearance of expansion bushings and keys
Transport turbine control parts back to site
Setting and testing turbine control system
Install coupling spacer and coupling guard
Check calibration of the torquemeter (if any)
underlined tasks to be considered as hold points.
All lifting activities for heavy parts (casing half- cover, casing half-cover turnover, rotor, complete machine) shall be done according site procedure with a corresponding lifting plan
Stop oil pumps when bearing T° < 60°C or machine is stop for more than 12 hours
Ensure that check valve located at extraction (or
All oil lines to be sealed with plastic bags and taped
Overhaul of trip valve, check and replace components (springs, bolts, bushings, valve stem)
Blue check of all valves/seats of control and trip valves
Transport turbine control parts to workshop
Check main condenser (including level measurement) and steam ejectors (if any)
Overhaul extraction piloted check valve (if any)
for bolts chich temperature is above 300°C replace bolts after 12 years in service
Check rotor end float and axial position and record
Check radial and thrust bearing clearances and record
Check axial position rotor-casing and record
Check split line bolts, length + NDT (MPI or DPT)
Lower turbine top half into lay-down area
Check rotor for damage and erosion
Check turbine casing and stator blades for erosion
Check rotor and casing seal strips for damage
Check Internal piping (vaccum lines, drain lines, gland steam)
Remove and clean bearing housing plates
Check internal alignment rotor-bearing houses and record
Confirm axial probes indicate same clearances as measured
Check labyrinth clearances in bottom casing and record
Set axial position rotor and record
Check laby clearances using lead wire (plastigage)
or bolts which temperature is higher than 300°C replace bolts after 12 years in service. (extended to 18years for back pressure turbines if not opened after 12 years)
Transport turbine control parts back to site
Check clearance of expansion bushings and keys
Check small piping (corrosion, thickness, dye-penetrant test)
Setting and testing turbine control system
Install coupling spacer and coupling guard
Check calibration of the torquemeter (if any)
underlined tasks to be considered as hold points.
All lifting activities for heavy parts (casing half- cover, casing half-cover turnover, rotor, complete machine) shall be done according site procedure with a corresponding lifting plan.
The overspeed tests are covered in the GM
Visual inspection gears (bull gear and pinion)
Check tooth contact bull gear and pinion
underlined tasks to be considered as hold points.
All lifting activities for heavy parts (casing half- cover, casing half-cover turnover, rotor, complete machine) shall be done according site procedure with a corresponding lifting plan.
Change out gear set (bull gear and pinions)
Visual inspection gears (bull gear and pinion) : + dye penetrant if same pinions and gears are reused
Check tooth contact bull gear and pinion
Send used gear set to OEM for detailed inspection
underlined tasks to be considered as hold points.
All lifting activities for heavy parts (casing half- cover, casing half-cover turnover, rotor, complete machine) shall be done according site procedure with a corresponding lifting plan.
mix installed hubs and spare spacer (or vice-versa)
(2 hubs+1 spacer) is one set and this set shall be balanced, all parts shall angular marked
Control and procedure for disassembly and re-assembly of couplings are detailed in the Minor and Major compressor overhaul task list.
Overhaul of dismantled coupling at OEM workshop
Visual Checking of the parts including the keys
Store the couplings in their box with balancing certificate.

During major trains overhaul, lube and seal oil systems shall be cleaned, flushed. The description of work here after shall be discussed and agreed with Contractor, specially concerning by-pass of bearing or the use of temporary screens. The oil cleanliness after flush shall be mutually accepted by the Plant and contractor before the commissioning.
Blind of N2 supply to oil reservoir
Check proper operation of oil heater (on/off/control)
Inspect and clean (manually) oil reservoir and
(NDT might be used to detect corrosion under deposit)
Inspection of oil reservoir for cleanliness
Clean filter basket inside stilling tank
Refill with new oil or use removed oil (depending on oil analysis)
When using screens upstream of bearing, do not forget to remove them after flushing => identify them by specific color
In some case high velocity flushing with external pum
Severe contamination of fouling (sometimes chemical clea
When event on the shaft line might have put some debr
If lube oil heat exchangers tube bundle is extracted and replaced.
Ensure that all main and by-pass supply valves are closed on:
Install blinds on all oil supply lines to bearings, seal
, and turbine control system (close to main supply line)
Lock control valves in full open position or use spool pieces
Install jump over lines between main oil supply lines (
ube, seal and control-oil) and common drain line
impulse lines to control valves are connected and valves tested (stroke)
Partially open manual by-pass back to reservoir
Start oil pump and regulate header pressure to normal value (use of turbine driven
Open by-pass valve over lube-oil supply slowly and check:
Lube-oil pressure and return oil flow
Inspect flushing strainers after few minutes
Increase duration of flushing according cleanliness of the strainers (up to 4 hours)
After 4 hours, stop oil pump and close main oil supply valve
Restart sequence until screen is clear of debris
tank can be difficult to handle due to low flow
in case of carbon steel piping the
Lube-oil supply to compressor and turbine
Replace blinds on lube-oil supply lines by flushing strainers
Put lube-oil pressure control-valve in service
Inspect flushing strainers after few minutes
Increase duration of flushing according cleanliness of the strainers (up to 4 hours)
After 4 hours, stop oil pump and close main oil supply valve
Replace blinds on seal-oil supply lines by flushing strainers
Put seal-oil pressure control valve in service
Inspect flushing strainers after few minutes
Increase duration of flushing according cleanliness of the strainers (up to 4 hours)
After 4 hours, stop oil pump and close main oil supply valve
Replace blinds on control-oil supply lines by flushing strainers
Put control-oil pressure control valve in service
Inspect flushing strainers after few minutes
Increase duration of flushing according cleanliness of the strainers (up to 4 hours)
After 4 hours, stop oil pump and close main oil supply valve
tank screen and clean when necessary
Remove all flushing strainers and close flanges using standard gaskets
The installation of blinds and jumps over lines may be not necessary in case the oil system shows no severe fouling
The oil flushing can start by installing flushing strainers on the main supply lines (lube, seal and control-oil) and additional strainers as close as possible to the equipment
his should be a plant decision
Oil temperature changes during flushing may help to remove fouling in the oil system
No leak during normal oil circulation
Proper working of lube oil pumps (local/remote)
Proper auto-start of spare pump (by adjusting PSL)
Propoer operation of PCV (lube oil seal oil) in normal circulation and during transient
Proper stroke of all actuators (governor valves)
Minor vs Major Compressor overhaul chart
For charge gas compressor, when compressor is stopped for minor overhaul, the risk of polymerization due to oxygen shall be assessed by process department.
